remarks: There is a line through any two distinct points.  Hilbert's axiom I.1 for geometry.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 29-Oct-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
statement:
hilbert1.1 $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ ( P e. ( EE ` N ) /\ Q e. ( EE ` N ) /\ P =/= Q ) ) -> E. x e. LinesEE ( P e. x /\ Q e. x ) ) $.
$d P x $.
$d Q x $.
